entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 10:03AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Melting snow and rain today will continue to push creeks and streams in Sheridan County higher. * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expect to occur soon. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 10:22PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Near-record to record temperatures continue Sunday, causing continued quick snowmelt in the high terrain. Area streams and rivers, especially those sourced from the Wind River Range are rising and may rise further through early next week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...River and stream flooding caused by snowmelt is expected.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 11 at 9:47PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm to record heat will continue through Sunday. These temperatures combined with windy conditions will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will reach their highest levels of this snowmelt season by the early to middle part of next week.
